item.title: Algorithm's Digital Garden and its Setup
item.description:
Introduction

How to deploy a website with a sync with GitHub Repository using Quartz 4.

What we need (for Windows)?

We need:

  1. Official documentation: https://quartz.jzhao.xyz/
  2. Node.js v22

LET US BEGIN…

Step 1: Cloning Repository

Run PowerShell / Terminal in admin mode only

Clone the Quartz Repository (at your location where you want to save your website): git clone https://github.com/jackyzha0/quartz.git

Step 2: Move into Cloned Repo

command: cd quartz

Step 3: Run Node Command to Create Quartz Instance

Do not run npm audit fix. This will break stuff.

item.title: BlogVerse and its setup
item.description:
My First Blog

This is my first blog. So…Hello!

What is BlogVerse

BlogVerse is my personal blogging website where I publish my blogs. This is a sync between Obsidian, Hugo and GitHub Pages.

What we need (for Windows)?

We need:

  1. Obsidian (of course, where we will be writing our posts)
  2. Go (Golang. A language used for Hugo)
  3. Git (for a Sync between GitHub and our posts)
  4. Hugo (A static website generator which comes with many themes…)
  5. Python (obviously a legend)
  6. PowerShell (I am Windows geek. Not safe, I know!)

If you don’t understand anything, use my own GitHub Repository, Stack Overflow, or any LLM model.
